intro: Allium filidens subsp. filidens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved garlic, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its bulbs are edible and have a mild garlic flavor, often used in culinary applications. It is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and hardy nature.
